title: Complex Working Memory: Beyond the Retention of List Sequences
abstractText:
This seminar series project involved four interconnected workshops in 2008-2009 revolving around the psychological themes of working memory and cognition. Each meeting had a different focus and involved both state-of-the-art scientific presentations, keynote addresses, and discussions of trends and ideas.

The meetings provided the opportunity for attendees to learn about contemporary research and engage in the shaping of priorities and projects in the field, and each meeting comprised both new and established academics (including postgraduates) and individuals working in applied or industrial settings.The discursive nature of the meetings encouraged a constructive reflection on psychological ideas and the setting of individual and collaborative agenda, which are often difficult to achieve in conventional conference / meeting formats.
